edu.vt.middleware.crypt
Class PbeKeyGenerator

java.lang.Object
  edu.vt.middleware.crypt.PbeKeyGenerator

public class PbeKeyGenerator
extends java.lang.Object

Generates secret keys from passwords/phrases in support of password-based encryption (PBE).

Version:
$Revision: 3 $
Author:
Middleware Services

Constructor Summary
PbeKeyGenerator(SymmetricAlgorithm algorithm)
          Creates a key generator that can generate PBE keys for use with the given symmetric cipher algorithm.

generatePkcs12

public javax.crypto.SecretKey generatePkcs12(char[] password,
                                             int keyBitLength,
                                             DigestAlgorithm digest,
                                             byte[] salt)
Generate a key from a text password using the PKCS#12 method described at http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2138.

Parameters:
password - Raw material used for key generation.
keyBitLength - Size of generated key in bits.
digest - Digest algorithm to use during key generation.
salt - Key initialization data.
Returns:
Secret key based on password.

generatePkcs12

                                int keyBitLength,
                                int ivBitLength,
                                DigestAlgorithm digest,
                                byte[] salt)
Generate a key/IV pair from a text password using the PKCS#12 method described at http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2138.

Parameters:
password - Raw material used for key generation.
keyBitLength - Size of generated key in bits.
ivBitLength - Size of generated IV in bits.
digest - Digest algorithm to use during key generation.
salt - Key initialization data.
Returns:
Secret key based on password.

generatePkcs5v2

public javax.crypto.SecretKey generatePkcs5v2(char[] password,
                                              int keyBitLength,
                                              byte[] salt)
Generate a key from a text password using the PKCS#5 version 2.0 method described at http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2127. A SHA-1 digest is used as the calculation function.

Parameters:
password - Raw material used for key generation.
keyBitLength - Size of generated key in bits.
salt - Key initialization data.
Returns:
Secret key based on password.

generatePkcs5v2

public KeyWithIV generatePkcs5v2(char[] password,
                                 int keyBitLength,
                                 int ivBitLength,
                                 byte[] salt)
Generate a key/IV pair from a text password using the PKCS#5 version 2.0 method described at http://www.rsa.com/rsalabs/node.asp?id=2127. A SHA-1 digest is used as the calculation function.

Parameters:
password - Raw material used for key generation.
keyBitLength - Size of generated key in bits.
ivBitLength - Size of generated IV in bits.
salt - Key initialization data.
Returns:
Secret key based on password.

generateOpenssl

public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateOpenssl(char[] password,
                                              int keyBitLength,
                                              byte[] salt)
Generate a key from a text password using a method based ok PKCS#5 version 2 that is consistent with that performed by the openssl enc operation.

Parameters:
password - Raw material used for key generation.
keyBitLength - Size of generated key in bits.
salt - Key initialization data.
Returns:
Secret key based on password.

generateOpenssl

public KeyWithIV generateOpenssl(char[] password,
                                 int keyBitLength,
                                 int ivBitLength,
                                 byte[] salt)
Generate a key/IV pair from a text password using a strategy compatible with the OpenSSL enc operation. The strategy is based on PKCS#5 version 2, but uses a MD5 hash instead of SHA1 and an iteration count of 1. For compatibility with OpenSSL, the IV size should be equal to key size.

Parameters:
password - Raw material used for key generation.
keyBitLength - Size of generated key in bits.
ivBitLength - Size of generated IV in bits.
salt - Key initialization data.
Returns:
Secret key based on password.
